title: Current Approaches to Personalized Web Search

author: Paul-Alexandre Chirita, Leibniz University of Hannover

segmentation: OK, so we are going to start with personalized web search.
This talk is a bit different from what we've seen so far.

Many extensions came after this, the first popular one was topic sensitive Pagerank.
The idea here is that you bias Pagerank on each of the 16 top level categories of ODP.
And then at runtime you compute the similarity between the query and each of these categories.
And you use this similarity scores to combine these 16 vectors into one which you then use to rank the results.
The good part is that this is really an adaptive algorithm.
It's probably the only one which adapts to the query.
The bad part is that it's not really personalization, at least not this basic form, but All in all, all users would get the same results.
It's so it's adaptive to the query.
Not to the user.
